Vocabularies.Definition: vt. cover or roll up 包，裹
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The shop assistant wrapped up the dress for her.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 使陷于困境;使坠入陷阱 n. 陷阱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The police trapped the thieves.
e.g.  He concealed the sweets in his pocket.
e.g.  The pressures of modern life are great.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. jump or fall suddenly and with force 纵身跳进
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He plunged into the water to save the child.
e.g.  Don't crush this box; it has flowers in it.
e.g.  A branch snapped off the tree in the wind.
e.g.  Don't squeeze the kitten; you will hurt it.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  晕倒;坍塌;垮下 vt. 毁坏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The old man collapsed in the street.
e.g. He shivered as he heard the strange noise in the night.

Vocabularies.Definition: be the duty or responsibility of 是...的职责
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It'up to us to give them all the help we can.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. no place 不存在的地方，不知名的地方
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He is nowhere to be seen.
e.g.  She was so quiet that her presence was hardly noticed.
e.g.  It's hard work, but if you hang on long enough you'll succeed.
